If we want to access the classes and functions offered by Pandas in a Python file or Jupyter notebook, we first need to import it.

```{python}
#| lst-label: lst-import-pandas
#| lst-cap: Code for importing the Pandas package.
import pandas as pd
```

You can name the imported module anything you like, but people usually call it `pd`. This means we can access Pandas' functionality via this name. As we will use the Pandas heavily, almost all chapters will start with @lst-import-pandas as their first line.
